definition: between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: When there is an indirect tax on commodity, supply decreases.
sentences.chinese: 當向商品徵收間接稅，供應減少。

sentences.english: The amount of indirect tax is paid by the producers to the government.
sentences.chinese: 間接稅的款項是由生產者支付給政府。

sentences.english: Few people understand what direct taxation and indirect taxation mean.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎沒有什麼人懂得直接稅與間接稅的含義。

sentences.english: VAT is the standard form of indirect tax paid throughout the European Union.
sentences.chinese: 在整個歐盟內，增值稅是標準的間接稅。

sentences.english: No tax or duty shall be laid on articles exported from any state.
sentences.chinese: 對於從任何一州輸入的貨物不得徵收直接稅或間接稅。

sentences.english: China's current tax system remains dominated by indirect taxes.
sentences.chinese: 我國目前的稅制體系仍然是以間接稅爲主。

sentences.english: It is close to the bottom on its use of indirect taxes.
sentences.chinese: 在使用間接稅方面，美國近乎老末。

sentences.english: Basically, any system can be divided into direct and indirect taxes.
sentences.chinese: 任何稅務制度，基本上都可以劃分爲直接稅與間接稅。
